With no profits for seven years, Nissan had accumulated debts of 20 billion dollars.
Carlos Ghosn devised a rescue strategy.
The newly-arrived foreigner was about to make 21,000 people redundant,...
He blamed previous bosses for overstaffing.
With the global payroll reduced by 14 percent, Nissan's fortunes revived.
Within a year, annual profits climbed back to 2 billion dollars...
...compared to losses of 6 billion dollars the year before.
